fullDescription.intro:
This node needs a MATLAB installation on the local machine!
The node converts the input table into a MATLAB type variable (dataset, map or structure), and makes it available in MATLAB's workspace as a variable named "kIn". There is also a variable "names", that is a structure allowing to associate the actual column names with the variabele names (not needed if the dataset type is used).
If matlab is not running, the node launches an instance of the MATLAB desktop. It is recommended to let KNIME start MATLAB the first time. That way the working direcotry of MATLAB will be changed to the location where KNIME stores the m-file to load the data in the workspace (manually you'll have to change directory into the temp-dir of the JVM that runs KNIME). Also the instruction. to re-load the data will be indicated in the Command Window at startup.
Detailed documentation about the scripting integration:
MPI-CBG SWEG Wiki
fullDescription.option: Select the MATLAB type of the variable that will contain the KNIME table in the MATLAB workspace

option.name: Run in a new MATLAB instance

fullDescription.option:
If checked, each time the node is executed it starts a new matlab instance. If unchecked it only starts an MATLAB instance if none is running.
To re-load the data in matlab type re-execute the m-file in the JVM's temp-dir.

ports.inPort: A table which should be pushed to R.
